item.title: Teresa add a quote by Lionel Shriver
item.description: "It's always the mother's fault, ain't it?" she said softly, collecting her coat. "That boy turn out bad cause his mama a drunk, or she a junkie. She let him run wild, she don't teach him right from wrong. She never home when he back from school. Nobody ever say his daddy a drunk, or his daddy not home after school. And nobody ever say they some kids just damned mean. ..." -- Lionel Shriver

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Thomas Tryon
item.description: "It is not easy to learn much about love, but one thing I discovered, that Lady Harleigh taught me: it is not whom you love that is important, but only that we love." -- Thomas Tryon

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Thomas Tryon
item.description: "This you must believe," she said, holding my gaze with an intent and profound expression, her eyes searching mine, "this you must absolutely believe if you will ever believe anything I shall ever tell you. It is not the coming together or the parting of two people that counts, or where or when, but those two people themselves, and in what manner they are joined. And if it is not with hate but with love, not with impatience but with understanding, and never with boredome but with interest, then nothing can be wrong with their being together, no matter how wrong it may seem to others. But those others, they do not count, they must not be permitted to count, for it is only between the two persons themselves that it must have meaning. It is not so difficult for people to arrange their lives sensibly if they behave sensibly, but to arrange their lives happily, that is a far, far different thing." -- Thomas Tryon

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Marguerite Duras
item.description: "I've known you for years. Everyone says you were beautiful when you were young, but I want to tell you I think you're more beautiful now than then. Rather than your face as a young woman, I prefer your face as it is now. Ravaged." -- Marguerite Duras

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Marguerite Duras
item.description: "When it's in a book I don't think it'll hurt any more ...exist any more. One of the things writing does is wipe things out. Replace them." -- Marguerite Duras

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "I had to touch you with my hands, I had to taste you with my tongue; one can't love and do nothing." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "Insecurity is the worst sense that lovers feel; sometimes the most humdrum desireless marriage seems better. Insecurity twists meanings and poisons trust." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "Pain is easy to write. In pain we're all happily individual. But what can one write about happiness?" -- Graham Greene

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "I'm tired and I'm sick to death of being without you." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "If two people loved, they slept together; it was a mathematical formula, tested and proved by human experience." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "I couldn't help wondering, is my husband so unattractive that no woman has ever wanted him? Except me, of course. I must have wanted him, in a way, once, but I've forgotten why, and I was too young to know what I was choosing." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "You needn't be so scared. Love doesn't end. Just because we don't see each other..." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "How strange too and unfamiliar to think that one had been loved, that one's presence had once had the power to make a difference between happiness and dullness in another's day." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Sometimes dead is better" -- Stephen King

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "May be she’ll learn something about what death really is, which is where the pain stops and the good memories begin. Not the end of life but the end of pain." -- Stephen King

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "It was the best of times, it was the worst of times." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Marguerite Duras
item.description: "Very early in my life it was too late." -- Marguerite Duras

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Burdens are for shoulders strong enough to carry them." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Death, taxes and childbirth! There's never any convenient time for any of them." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Life's under no obligation to give us what we expect. We take what we get and are thankful it's no worse than it is." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Babies, babies, babies. Why did God make so many babies? But no, God didn't make them. Stupid people made them." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "There’ll always be wars because men love wars. Women don’t, but men do.." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "God help the man who ever really loves you." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Lionel Shriver
item.description: "You can call it innocence, or you can call it gullibility, but Celia made the most common mistake of the good-hearted: she assumed that everyone else was just like her." -- Lionel Shriver

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Lionel Shriver
item.description: "How lucky we are, when we're spared what we think we want!" -- Lionel Shriver

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Lionel Shriver
item.description: "I was mortified by the prospect of becoming hopelessly trapped in someone else's story." -- Lionel Shriver

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Matthew Quick
item.description: "Life is not a PG feel-good movie. Real life often ends badly. Literature tries to document this reality, while showing us it is still possible for us to endure nobly." -- Matthew Quick

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Matthew Quick
item.description: "I am practicing being kind over being right." -- Matthew Quick

item.title: Teresa add a quote by Matthew Quick
item.description: "You need to make time for your family no matter what happens in your life" -- Matthew Quick
